# Java

```java

import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class Main {
		static int n,m;
		static int[] a;
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
		n = sc.nextInt();
		a= new int[n];
		
		for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
			int temp = sc.nextInt();
			a[i] =temp;
		}
		
		Arrays.sort(a);
		m = sc.nextInt();
		
		for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
			int temp = sc.nextInt();
			binarySearch(temp);
		}
		
		
	}
	private static void binarySearch(int target) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		int mid;
		int left =0;
		int right = n-1;
		
		while(left <= right) {
			mid = (left+right)/2;
			
			
			if(a[mid] ==target) {
				System.out.println("1");
				return;
			}
			
			if(a[mid] < target) {
				left= mid+1;
			}
			
			if(a[mid] > target) {
				right= mid-1;
			}
			
			
		}
		
		System.out.println("0");
	}

}

```

# C++

```c++

#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <algorithm>
#include <vector>
#include<iostream>
#include<queue>
#include<string>
#include<climits>
#include<deque>

using namespace std;

int n;
int m;
int a[100001];

void binary(int target) {
	int mid;
	int right = n - 1;
	int left = 0;

	while (left <= right) {
		mid = (left + right) / 2;

		if (a[mid] == target) {

			printf("%d\n", 1);
			return;
		}

		if (a[mid] < target) {
			left = mid + 1;
		}

		if (a[mid] > target) {
			right = mid - 1;
		}
	}
	printf("%d\n", 0);
}

int main() {
	scanf("%d", &n);

	for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
		int temp;
		scanf("%d", &temp);
		a[i] = temp;
	}

	sort(a, a + n);

	scanf("%d", &m);
	for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
		int temp;
		scanf("%d", &temp);
		binary(temp);
	}


	return 0;
}


```
